channel.title: [PI]Bonus Exp for Donators and Beginners[PI]
channel.description:
On my source, donators are player rights 1. How do I make it so donators get 1.5x exp? (Or 2x, whatever. Just show me how to make code and how to edit multiplier.)
Also, how do I make it so beginners receive 2x more exp the first hour they are online? (Wears off after 60 minutes.)

item.title: [PI]Bonus Exp for Donators and Beginners[PI]
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

Actually, they’re pretty much the same… All you have to do is change a few method calls and possible some variable names (Which you can find by searching)

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Bonus Exp for Donators and Beginners[PI]
item.dc:creator: @Ddragonimp Ddragonimp
item.description:
@Ddragonimp wrote:

[size=18pt]Now i know PI is differnt Coding but this is just the basics it would be a perfect fix for Delta But PI is differnt unsure with the coding[/size]

should see something like this

	public boolean addSkillXP(int amount, int skill) {
		if ((amount + playerXP[skill]) < 0 || amount + playerXP[skill] > 200000000 || playerXP[skill] >= 200000000) {
			playerXP[skill] = 200000000;
			refreshSkills();
			return false;
		}
		int oldLevel = getLevelForXP(playerXP[skill]);
		// int[] statId = {4004, 4008, 4006, 4016, 4010, 4012, 4014, 4034, 4038, 
		// 4026, 4032, 4036, 4024, 4030, 4028, 4020, 4018, 4022, 4152};
		playerXP[skill] += amount;
		if (oldLevel < getLevelForXP(playerXP[skill])) {
			// if(oldLevel >= 85)
			specGFX(199);
			//checkPlayerCapes.achievedMax(skill, this);
			playerLevel[3] = getLevelForXP2(playerXP[skill]);
			playerLevel[skill] = getLevelForXP(playerXP[skill]);
			playerLevel[3] = getLevelForXP2(playerXP[skill]);
			// stillgfx(623, absY, absX);
			// levelup(skill);
			updateRequired = true;
			appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
			sM("Congratulations, you just advanced a "
					+ statName[skill] + " level.");
			getTotalLevel();
			if (playerLevel[skill] > 90)
			// sendFrame126(playerName + " (" + combatLevel + ")", 6572);
			setSkillLevel(skill, playerLevel[skill], playerXP[skill]);
		}
			refreshSkills();
		// setSkillLevel(skill, playerLevel[skill], playerXP[skill]);
		if (skill == 2) {
			CalculateMaxHit();
		}
		return true;

	}

Just modify to say the following

	public boolean addSkillXP(int amount, int skill) {
		if ((amount + playerXP[skill]) < 0 || amount + playerXP[skill] > 200000000 || playerXP[skill] >= 200000000) {
			playerXP[skill] = 200000000;
			refreshSkills();
			return false;
		}
		int oldLevel = getLevelForXP(playerXP[skill]);
		// int[] statId = {4004, 4008, 4006, 4016, 4010, 4012, 4014, 4034, 4038, 
		// 4026, 4032, 4036, 4024, 4030, 4028, 4020, 4018, 4022, 4152};
		if (playerRights == 1) 
                {
		amount = amount*(3/2);
		}//Coding is right here              --- Fixed BY DDRAGONIMP
		playerXP[skill] += amount;
		if (oldLevel < getLevelForXP(playerXP[skill])) {
			// if(oldLevel >= 85)
			specGFX(199);
			//checkPlayerCapes.achievedMax(skill, this);
			playerLevel[3] = getLevelForXP2(playerXP[skill]);
			playerLevel[skill] = getLevelForXP(playerXP[skill]);
			playerLevel[3] = getLevelForXP2(playerXP[skill]);
			// stillgfx(623, absY, absX);
			// levelup(skill);
			updateRequired = true;
			appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
			sM("Congratulations, you just advanced a "
					+ statName[skill] + " level.");
			getTotalLevel();
			if (playerLevel[skill] > 90)
			// sendFrame126(playerName + " (" + combatLevel + ")", 6572);
			setSkillLevel(skill, playerLevel[skill], playerXP[skill]);
		}
			refreshSkills();
		// setSkillLevel(skill, playerLevel[skill], playerXP[skill]);
		if (skill == 2) {
			CalculateMaxHit();
		}
		return true;

	}

the coding is this line here

		if (playerRights == 1) 
                {
		amount = amount*(3/2);
		}//Coding is right here              --- Fixed BY DDRAGONIMP

Read full topic
